body:
<!-- Describe the issue -->

Compiled what I thought was the source code for 0.22 but end up with "22.99".

<!--- What behavior did you expect? -->

I expected to get a self-built version 0.22

<!--- What was the actual behavior (provide screenshots if the issue is GUI-related)? -->

$ bitcoind --version                       
Bitcoin Core version v22.99.0-f036c35e51fe

<!--- How reliably can you reproduce the issue, what are the steps to do so? -->

I have only compiled once, but I presume this is going to be the same every time.

<!-- What version of Bitcoin Core are you using, where did you get it (website, self-compiled, etc)? -->

As I needed to compile for myself (I needed 32 bit linux) I went to find the source code, as I realize the master branch is for development and not a release I looked at other brances :

https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/branches

The only "22" I could see was:

https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/tree/22.x

I git cloned that then compiled following the instructions in the build linux document.

That worked fine, seemed to be ok and ended up with an exectuable.

<!-- What type of machine are you observing the error on (OS/CPU and disk type)? -->

This is a 32 bit Linux Mint version 19


I presume I've taken the wrong source.  If so, where is the right one and how might I or indeed other people find it more easily?

It seems I'm not the only one to make this mistake as looking at stats show many nodes running "22.99":

https://bitnodes.io/nodes/leaderboard/?q=%2FSatoshi%3A22.99
title: Self-compiled ended up with "22.99" instead of "0.22"
